Reviews.Title: “Has potential”
Reviews.Author: loulou1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Golden Gate this past week. We have gambled here in the past and really liked this little casino and Dupars restaurant inside. We were comped 3 days, so we said "WHY NOT" The rooms are very small, but clean. The bathroom was extremely small, there wasn't ANY counter space. I was a little nervous about my straightening iron falling in the mini toilet(love short toilets). They are in the middle of a HUGE remodel. One day one hall was closed on our floor the next day another was closed on our floor. It was just a hassle getting from room to casino. I would stay here again, I know once they are complete with the remodel it will be a cozy place to stay and gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dorens
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed @ this hotel for the first time after gambling in the casino for years. All the rooms have been recently renovated and though small are actually quite nice. This is a very old hotel & casino so there are some "charming" features. The bathrooms have (probably) 1950's tile but are more than adequate. We stayed right on Fremont St. so had an awesome people watching & street entertainment experience. Don't stay here if you want peace and quiet but if you want to see some really fun things on the street this is the place. There was a stage right under our room so we had a birds eye view of all the goings on. BTW, the music stops @ 2am on wkends & midnight the rest of the week. The best thing about this casino is the people , some of the staff have worked here for over 40 yrs & it's like coming home year after year. Not stuffy like so many other casinos.All in all I will stay here again nxt year.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond In The Rough”
Reviews.Author: HavasuFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I gambled here on New Year's Eve and had some luck so we spent a few hours here. Fast forward to now, they sent us free room offers (ALWAYS SIGN UP FOR PLAYERS CLUB CARDS!!!) so we decided to stay last weekend. We really enjoyed The Golden Gate. Some other reviews said it was noisy so I'll comment on that first. Yes you can hear the music if you are in one of the rooms near Freemont St., but it is not too loud that you can't sleep over it. Who goes to Vegas to go to bed early anyway??!! Outside Bar - The bar outside has all the slushy drinks my wife likes plus Blue Moon on tap and beautiful scantily clad girls dancing on the bar 5 out of 5 stars there!! Hotel - We were in a room on the 4th floor near the street, so we could definitely hear the music, but like I said, it's not really that loud. The hallway on the 4th floor was hot and stuffy, but they might have had the AC off because of the construction. We were pleasantly surprised when we opened our door, the room had nice clean carpet, fresh paint, and nice furnishings. The bed was comfortable and soft. 4 out of 5 stars Gaming - Plenty of available machines with some of the newest games. I loved the Hangover machine! I only played a little bit of Pai Gow and a little Blackjack, but the dealers were friendly. One thing I didn't like was the layout of the pit, I think it's too wide to be between the bar and the wall. Every time we had to walk by it we had to squeeze through pit spectators or bar patrons. Maybe make the pit a little more narrow, yes it may inconvenience the dealers and floor persons but they're not the ones paying the casino's bills the players are. 4 out of 5 stars Dupar's - Great shrimp cocktail with a nice zesty cocktail sauce! I got the prime rib with baked potato and veggies. The veggies were cooked perfect, not too mushy, the potato was cooked well and had a great salt/pepper seasoning on the skin, and the prime rib was average (could have been more tender). My wife had the cobb salad which was fantastic with REAL bacon and lots of it. We also enjoyed reading the history on the placemat while waiting for our food. :) 5 out of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the casino and will stay at the GG next time out!”
Reviews.Author: mlr8105
Reviews.Content: Was in town from March 8 thru 13th. Stayed at the MSS but made a few visits to the Golden Gate and loved the casino even though they have construction on the backside. The bar has great service and the GO-GO dancers behind the tables and out front are great! They have plenty of slots and tables to choose from even though it is a small place. I will book a room for my next vist (May) so I can get the full GG experience- I will let you know!

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic place to crash downtown with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: bobscottonline
Reviews.Content: Booked a Sunday night stay November 2011 to squeeze in a night downtown. Wow, this place rocks! There is no better place to kick it old school Vegas than in the oldest hotel and at a sub $25/nt rate with no resort fee. This place is reminiscent of a shore boarding house with small rooms, tight bathrooms and short entrance ways. Was given a room with a queen bed. Room was nicely renovated with new furnishings and bath lovingly restored. I had a widow that opened to the alleyway. It was pretty quiet but I left the window open and was awoke by the trash collection. It sounded like they were filming a Transformers battle scene until the window was closed. Staff was friendly and check in/out a breeze. Casino is full of nostalgia as well. Go-Go girl dealers are a nice touch. There was construction going on for a major renovation coming in 2013-14? to include additional gaming and rooms. Parking valet was 1/2 block from check-in, passed the renovation site but a quick walk. Look forward to staying again once the renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: I almost feel like a traitor in writing this review. I really liked the Golden Gate, the remodeled rooms, the shrimp cocktails, the coziness of the casino. I was not impressed on my last visit. I will say, my sister still loves it here. I think the number one complaint from me is the noise. When you are gambling at night, you have the music the casino is playing, the noise from machines and the noise from the bands and light show on Fremont Street. It really got to me this time. We were put in a room on Fremont street, this is where the majority of the double bed rooms are. You are in your room and the band is in there with you playing as loud as they can. Ear plugs do not help at all. So I had all the noise from the casino at night and then I couldn't escape it in the room. After two nights changed rooms to one away from Fremont. This room was a bit more quiet but you could still really hear Fremont Street. This was a Friday night and they were still going at 1:30am. The bathrooms are still the same with my major complaint of the caulking needing to be redone, it's gross. The products they provide are from Bath and Body now, I liked them. The room itself is clean. They still have the coffee maker and snacks in room but you do pay for both. The beds are very comfortable. I was disappointed to hear from one of the employees that the new suites they are building are only going to have king beds with a couch pull out. I don't understand this at all. If there are three of us, who wants to sleep on a pull out? Hopefully that info was wrong. I think they should take a few of the single rooms which are away from Fremont and make them larger with two beds. Part of the fun is staying with the people you came with. Also a disappointment is the deli is gone, not sure if it will be brought back. That leaves Dupar's which does have really good food (awesome pancakes). They now serve the wonderful shrimp cocktails but they raised the price. I only had one, where usually I would have about 4 during my stay. It just wasn't the same. It was fun before with being able to get your shrimp cocktail and eat it while watching the casino. For the expansion, they have added a couple of new areas for slots which is nice. The new restrooms are awesome. The new lobby was roped off but looked very nice. There was a blonde cocktail waitress who was very nice. She found me when I moved slots to deliver my drink. I did have a little bit of luck in the casino. I still like the fact that the casino and hotel are small. Easy to find the people you are with and easy to get to your room. Will I stay here again, not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Buy the shrimp, but never stay here”
Reviews.Author: bjed
Reviews.Content: I had received an offer for a free room at the Golden Gate. My wife and I have stayed in sixteen hotels in Vegas, and this was the worst. We can see past the construction, the small room, the door hitting my knee when my wife opened the bathroom door, but we could not overcome the smell. The hallway and room smelled like a dirty nursing home. We left the hotel and got a room somewhere else due to the aroma. So, technically I did not stay in the hotel because the smell was so bad we could not. Even for free, it was not worth it. Did I mention the air conditioning was also not working? I was told it was b because the temperature kept fluctuating outside so they did not have it on. Honestly. This was the worst hotel I have ever been to or attempted to stay in while traveling to Vegas. Do not stay here. Shrimp cocktail is great, hotel is awful.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more.”
Reviews.Author: CariBelle
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that my expectations were pretty low, but I was still let down. The check in was easy and no elevator line (we checked in around 5 PM on a Thursday) but once we made it to the room I wanted to run and not come back. The carpet was dirty, the bathroom looked like it belonged in some horror movie about a European hostel, and the tub looked like it was left over from the original 1906 rooms. The noise from Fremont was booming (yes I expected this) but I didn't expect our windows to have broken latches so that they opened a little more with each bass boom. We are night owls in Vegas so by the time we got back to our room after dinner and gambling at 4:30 AM the noise on Fremont was gone, but cut to 4 hours later and the music was back playing over loud speakers. Who's awake at 8:30 AM in Vegas?! The worst part of this room was the shower. Stained, no mat in the bottom or grip stickers so I had to curl my toes to keep from slidding around, and the shower curtain was so moldy that I serioulsy wanted to throw up after touching it on accident. How hard is it to change a moldy shower curtain?! So gross. If we had been there for more than 2 nights I would have moved hotels. I gave it 3 stars because the casino and 24 hour diner are redeeming qualities and frankly, it was free so I can't hate on it too much. We will give the expansion a try after it opens, but I might pack my own shower curtain, just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kev8971
Reviews.Content: Nice clean newly done boutique style rooms. Small , yes, but well appointed. Flatscreen, kuerig coffee maker, great view. We stayed in 208, only reccomended if you want the Fremont party experience, double windows open up onto the fremont experience, giving you a front row seat.......till 3am whether you want it or not. Great bed, super friendly staff, loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Grain of salt”
Reviews.Author: ibbyCalif
Reviews.Content: Some hotels used to make obscene charges to use the phone, many no longer do. The latest scam the hospitality industry is foisting on us is resort fees. Watch for these any time you book.THERE ARE NO RESORT FEES HERE !!! TAKE THIS REVIEW W GRAIN OF SALT. I Stayed here on 12/27/11 , this is a time when Vegas catches its' breath just before New Years Eve. It is quieter, less crowded, and expensive than most other times of the yr. U may have a less pleasant experience when u visit at peak times. There is a also remodel/ expansion underway, I did not experience any probems because of this. This might change as work continues, one of the workers told me it would be June of 2012 before the work is completed. My room was 345, it faced Main St .I did not experience any internal noise from other rooms but I coud hear the muted sounds from the Fremont St. Experience along w some traffic noise from Main St. This is a free (except for New Years Eve) light and sound show that takes place nightly.There is a canopy over the street imbeded w millions (literally) of lights on which images are projected in concert w a very loud sound show. I imagine it could get quite loud, especially if you stay toward the front of the hotel.I think the last show ends at midnight. Was never concerned about safety, the riff raf that used to frequent the area has been chased away.There is a lobby guard at night, visitors must sign in. TV remote did not work (batteries?) other than that, everything worked liked it was supposed to. Temperatures were comfortable in room and common areas despite 35 degree outside night temps. Some smoke in the casino, none in the room. Coud sense cooking smells in 3rd floor lobby, but not in room. There was some dirty grout in the base of the shower and some balled- up papers in drawer, otherwise , place was clean. Staff was friendly ,especially the valets and the 7pm server and mgr at Dupars restaurant. Ez check in/out, very low tech . At check in desk, they have a mail cubbyhole for each room . This place is fairly typical for the area.It has only 4 floors ( they are adding more) Properties on Fremont are smaller, older,w far fewer bells/whistles than their strip counterparts . There was only valet parking ( they were fast/friendly ) no pool. gym, spa, business center, babysitting, arcade, concierege, buffet, news stand , gift shop , sports book or showroom . There was ice/ vending,a Dupars Deli where they serve their famous shrimp cocktail ( it is no longer 99 cents) The Dupars restaurant/bakery is open 24/7, serves good comfort food, huge quantities , w GREAT service at fair prices. There were many locals there who come here just for the food. I was alone, did not have to wait, just sat at the counter. Looks like they are going after the younger demographic, many of the dealers were young women in sexy outfits , some danced when they are not dealing. During my stay, most of the other patrons were in their 50's.They have a slot club, no charge to join. Nice bar/friendly staff. Room looked just like the website picture, but it is SMALL ,maybe 125 sq feet. Watch the small step from room to bathroom, you could trip. Bathroom had shower stall, no tub. Vanity area not separate from shower area w no hair dryer, there were some toiliteries. Small closet w no iron/ board, there is a safe in the lobby. No desk, there is a fee for wireless, there is a computer in the lobby (not free) There is a flat screen TV, clock radio w ipod dock, phone w v/mail. Phone says there is a charge for local calls, desk clerk says it is free. There is a cofee maker and snack basket ( not free) bed was comfy, sheets were clean. Place looks like it's ok if you are disabled , but no pets are allowed. There is stuff to do here. Fremont was the main street in Vegas. It is now an open air mall where the nightly light/sound show takes, there are also shops, bars, restaurants, small casinos and hotel/ casinos. There are kiosks selling cell phones, etc, street performers, and a zip line ride. Looks like they are adding theaters on the east end. Newest eatery addition is the Heart Attack Cafe, its sells HUGE burgers ( 1 has 6000 calories) There's an ambuance out front, the servers wear sexy nurse outfits, if you weigh over 350 lbs, you eat free.There are lost of other places to dine that won't stress out your cardiologist. Across the street, the ex mayor has old style steak house w a Rat Pack vibe. Further to the west, there is some kind of huge trade center, I did not get a chance to go there. Go south on Main, you will find the arts district that includes the Smith Center and some antique places. East on Fremont and north on LV Blvd you will find a neon sign museum ( closed when I was there), an under construction gangster museum, the Cashman Convention Ctr, a natural history and kids discovey center museum. The LV Area 51's AAA baseball team in the PCL plays here too. Go south on LV Blvd and you will find Govt buildings,wedding chapels, antique and pawn shops ( Pawn Stars place is here, line to enter was huge ) Nearest big Strip place is the Stratosphere which is couple of miles so of Fremont /LV BL. Hotel is close to all freeways. Greyhound Stops at the Plaza Hotel across the St. Amtrak bus ( no trains stop in LV anymore) stop here too. A little south on Main is the RTC terminal. from here, U can get all over LV on the clean/economical bus system. Some run 24/7. 2 lines run directly to the airport. There is a double deck ( the Deuce) and an articulated bus that runs on LV Bl , this is a good way to check out the strip wo driving. It is $2 a pop to ride, if u plan to get on/off, get a day pass. It's not fast, Strip traffic is always bad, use side streets or the fwy if you drive or are in a hurry.Some Strip hotels have rear entrances. Not sure what a cab/limo would cost to get to the Strip or airport. Check Bell Trans or Grayline . Was here to see the LV Wranglers ECHL hockey team play at the Orleans Hotel Arena. This is 2 miles west of LV Bl on Tropicana . Very modern/ clean facility w no bad seats. Reasonable ticket prices and unique intermission entertainment. One time, the Blue Man Group did a mini show. The game I went to this time started at midnight. Team is usually competitive, they were in 1st place when I was there. They are NHL Calgary's farm team. Paid $39 , they put a $100 deposit on your reservation that is voided if you do not trash the room . No frequent customer program. NO RESORT FEES! The Gate is the oldest place in town, it is small and well maintained, but has few extras. There is a a remodel/ expansion in progress until June, 2012. Did not mind staying here, I do not linger in my room when I travel. It was clean, safe, friendly,, and economical.That is enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: snorkelsal
Reviews.Content: I love historic places so I was excited to stay at the Golden Gate. As previously stated the rooms were small and the bathrooms old. This is common in old hotels. Most importantly, the room was clean and comfortable and I felt safe. Now to the best part of our stay. The casino staff was great. We sat at the bar for morning coffee and talked to the bartenders. They were very friendly and were able to tell us a lot about the history of the place as well as future plans. They also showed off some of their extreme bartending tricks. Management has done a great job at making this place a fun place to be. The day we left they were beginning some renovations so I will be excited to see the results when I stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, small but clean room”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2-nights in early November. I was on the 4th floor facing away from Fremont. As I said, room was small(as expected!) but clean. There was only a shower stall in the bathroom no tub. Loved gambling at the GG, and eating at DuPar's! Though my room was comped I'd pay to stay at the GG if I had to. The only negative I could offer was that there was not an iron or ironing board in the room. Had to get one from the front desk. A minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value and a touch of old Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Whitlam H
Reviews.Content: Did like this hotel. Wasn't too sure what to expect but the staff were friendly and the location was fab. Just a few minor downsides. The toilet was a bit on the dirty side so we had to wipe the seat down (yuck!) and the windows had a big opening in the glass and seal which let the wind through (so quite noisy as well). The maintenance man did turn up very quickly though and did a quick fix which was sufficient for our stay. These things didn't spoil our trip though - you are in Vegas after all! Good value for money and would still recommend it to anyone wanting their first stay on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Old School”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT D
Reviews.Content: I love this old time small casino- hotel. It harkens back to old Vegas.....rooms redone in last few years.....very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great location Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: injustifiiable
Reviews.Content: Awesome location at the beginning of Fremont Street Experience. I checked in at 5:30pm on a Friday and was given a smoking room instead of the non-smoking room I requested. Not a big deal, but thankfully, the room itself didn't smell all that smoky. I had room 249 on the second floor...it was literally five steps from the elevator. The room was indeed small, BUT nicely renovated with goodies such as a flat-screen HDTV, comfortable pillow top bedding, and a Keurig coffee maker (they sell the actual K-Cups from the honor basket for about a $1.50 each, not bad!). The room faced Main Street and the Plaza. I love the hotel key...it's one of the most unique keys I've ever seen...it looks more like a USB drive. The joint itself is pretty small anyway, so it's pretty easy to get to where you need to be. Tried the Shrimp Cocktail...not too shabby. Had a couple of them while playing nickel slots with the free play I got by joining the Player's Club. Oh, and did I mention CHEAP table games? $5 BlackJack that pays 3:2!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cmsrosa
Reviews.Content: Excellant location, right at the beginning of light show. Rooms were big enough for us, clean and incredibly cheep. Would definatly go back if I were going to stay in the area and it was so cheep, free parking and clean. Vey close to the outlet chopping centre. The only negative I can say is that the corridors smelt of dirty nappies!! But the room didnt.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a couple of nights!”
Reviews.Author: ksmith79
Reviews.Content: We love to spend a few nights in the downtown area when we are in Vegas. This time we decided to give the Golden Gate a try. The location is great, the price is great & the staff is exceptional. The rooms are small and I do mean small. The 1st room we were given was super small - like inside cabin on a cruise ship small - & it had a horrible odor! We inquired about switching, which the gentleman at the front desk did without hesitation. Our next room was a little bit bigger, but still small. The room was clean & comfortable - not bad for a couple of days. May consider staying here again, but will probably try 4 Queens & Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: stevez49Milford_NH
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed a couple of nites here. I was lucky enough to get a room facing FSE, I was able to open my window and listen to the bands and music while I was falling asleep. It does not get any better than that! The casino is fun and lively. Comps are good. Dupars and their deli are excellent. Drink service is good and the dealers are a fun and sexy group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: sidewallcindy
Reviews.Content: updated bedroom, but very small. The bathroom is stuck in the 30's. Only one luggage cart. Front Desk staff needs to work on raising their head out from the computer screen. Deli staff very friendly. We had our room facing North Main on the corner of Fremont. I love the location but a bit noisy with the band outside the window.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: czechchick1976
Reviews.Content: We stay here often when we're in Vegas. Here's the thing, it is small, it is old, it can be loud at night. Anyone who has done minimal research should know this, so expect it going in. Once you know these things, this place is GREAT! The ambiance is awesome, being the oldest hotel in Vegas. Has the best, old Vegas, antique feel. Only four floors. The rooms are small, but we have never felt that has hindered us in any way --- after all, we're mostly in there to sleep. Super comfy bed, nice tv, small bathroom but with a great rain shower head, keurig machine in the room (yes, you have to pay 1.50 to use it but still alot cheaper than going down to starbucks). We stayed on the corner facing fremont st and plaza. We could hear the band late at night, but didn't really keep us from sleeping. We knew that would be the case when we asked for the room on that front side. The staff is SUPER nice. This is also the most fun place to gamble. DuPar's and the deli are really good. WE LOVE THE GATE!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for or even less”
Reviews.Author: Danielle M
Reviews.Content: First off rooms are tiny, oh well. You get what you pay for, but when you have toilet that will not stop flushing at 12am and the front desk rudely informs you they have no maintenance on site and no rooms (lie cause they gave me another room) very rudely you get less. Customer service at night was the poorest Ive experienced by far. We got to our 2nd room at 1am TV did not work and in the morning our room had zero cold water. Showering was unbearable, I could not even wash my face. Our non smoking room also reeked of smoke even moreso than the room before or even the casino itself. They comped our first night stay, the cheapest night we stayed but I would not recommend this hotel at all. Pay the extra money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, affordable, good location...”
Reviews.Author: spanky132
Reviews.Content: Ok, these are some of the tiniest rooms I've ever stayed in. Smaller than NYC rooms even! Ditto on the bathrooms. Having said that the location is great, the staff is super, and the rooms were clean and reasonably updated. If you are on a Budget the Gate will serve you well. tip: ask for an "exterior room" ... The interior rooms don't really have a window/view.

Reviews.Title: “Charm with a bit of wear”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: The casino is classy and charming with its nod to history. The rooms have received a renovation, but were not fully satisfying. The hotel is a option worth considering when budget matters. Rooms are the quite small, mine had ancient windows and inadequate A/C. The renovation of decor and furnishings was nice. Flatscreen, comfy bed, coffee maker. Unfortunate location of room over alleyway with dumpster made for a bit much noise at times. Great price for Derby weekend made it a good value. No desire to repeat with other choices nearby on Fremont, especially the renovated Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a stay”
Reviews.Author: marsli
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect as the reviews have been mixed but what a pleasant suprise. Room with 2 double beds not side by side but on opposite walls, really a nice set up. Loved the furnishings and yes the bathroom was small but it was clean. For those who have slammed this place get real. If you want a 5 star hotel pay for it but don't knock this little gem that doesn't claim to be anything that it's not.

Reviews.Title: “On Fremont Street, But That's All”
Reviews.Author: KrisztaV77
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spent 3 nights with my husband and friends here but we missed our connecting flight in Europe so at the end there was only 2. Well, both rooms were extremely tiny and the restrooms were old and dirty. There was really cold outside (New Year's Eve in 2010) and we had almost frozen, as the unbelievable old heater did not make the rooms warmer. In addition, the heaters were very noisy so we could not sleep at all... Honestly Fremont Street was not as loud as those old heaters... Shrimp cocktail was perfect, we were on the Fremont Street, close to the Fremont Street Experience, but next time we will choose another place for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: HAILEYGRAM
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from another stay. The only complaint I had is with the noise level on the Fremont side of the hotel. You wil get that with each hotel on Fremont, so not just a Golden Gate issue. Room was clean, bed very, very comfy and the coffee maker was not as complicated as some seem to think, it is a Keurig, with the directions on the front with pictures. Staff is more than friendly, comps are great and the food at the Deli and DuPars is far above par. I love the historic value of the hotel and the employees are very polite and friendly. I will be back there again to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin? Avoid, avoid, avoid!! Not worth the cheap rate!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaWoman42
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in July because of the location (I don't like the strip) and also because of the price. What a cost it was to me overall. The valet stuck his hand in the little console shelf on my car looking for money, and he broke the little plastic door. I'm so glad I don't keep money in the car, but I was furious. Despite the fact that I spoke with the security person and the manager of the hotel right on the valet lot as soon as I discovered this, the hotel has denied responsibility, of course. Toyota would like $375.00 to fix this, as the entire console front must be replaced. Then we get to the room.... The strange little annoying coffee maker (at $1.50 per cup) was impossible to figure out. There are no useful directions, and I had to call Housekeeping to get someone to explain it to me. The man who came up said he goes to four or five rooms per week to explain the silly machine. What a poor use of an employee's time. The room was very very tiny, requiring holding one's breath to get between the bed and the wall. Fremont Street makes a lot of noise, but if you're in a rear room, it's tolerable. The hotel corridors are rather strange, and the hotel is quite old, but both those things one can live with. What I cannot accept is the hotel not even offering to share the cost of my damaged console. The manager said, when we discussed the damage, that he could think of "a few different scenarios" to explain my broken console door. To me, this implies that I was a scammer. Not likely, since I am a teacher, and my 14-year old granddaughter was with me. Another scenario might be that the aliens came down and did this? Never, never, never again at this hotel. If you do stay there, for whatever reason, park across the street at the Las Vegas Club's valet parking. It's an easy walk across the street. At least it is covered, where the Golden Gate's is sitting in the hot hot sun. Better yet, stay at the Las Vegas Club, or the newly renovated Plaza Hotel. The prices should be comparable, and the valet parking has to be better!

Reviews.Title: “never again @ golden gate hotel & casino”
Reviews.Author: chestnutbrown
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided last minute for a weekend getaway, so I booked my hotel @ the Golden gate which i thought was the least expensive hotel on Fremont. When we arrive there the valet was awesome, entering the lobby to check in was just okay for us... the person behind the counter was really helpful. But the worse is yet to come, there was only 1 elevator up to the rooms it was old & stinky...when we check in our room, i was horrified...the room was so old & outdated, the TV didn't work, the alarm clock didn't work, the bathroom was a total nightmare...etc. So I went downstairs to complain to the front desk, he upgrade us to another room which was a little better than the first room, but still the whole atmosphere of the hotel was spooky, especially the hallways. I know it's a really old casino, but it sure felt like i was staying in a filthy place. But the only good thing about the hotel is the shrimp cocktail and the fremont experience was definitely a plus. But still i do NOT recommended this hotel to anyone!!! :(

Reviews.Title: “Shrimp Cocktail better now”
Reviews.Author: gary c
Reviews.Content: yes, they raised the price of the famous shrimp cocktail to $1.99. But no more baby shrimp, it boasts larger and tastier shrimp now, actually a better deal than before!

Reviews.Title: “Creepy and just plain old”
Reviews.Author: njgirl05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on a quick weekend getaway to Vegas the first weekend in August. We found a very low rate and decided to stay on Freemont Street for the first time, knowing that there would be a big difference from the Strip hotels. I relied on tripadvisor reviews, and let me tell you...I was still pretty shocked. Lets start with the positives: Easy check in-the valet service was a nice touch and the attendants always ask if you will be going out again, so your car will be easily accessible. The check in staff was awesome..the lady at the counter was funny, friendly and very helpful. I needed an iron and she got me one right away. The shrimp cocktails are as great as everyone says..readily available and super cheap!!! The restaurant was also a nice surprise..a great retro feel with great breakfast choices. Had some luck in the casino. The cons: The elevator smells like vomit and urine. It lingered the whole time we were there. The evening we arrived there was a drunk puking in the check in lobby. Seriously, just GROSS. The hallways are SCARY. Our room was tucked away in a corner that my husband affectionately named "murder alley". Creepy..seriously very creepy. The room we had was TINY. I knew from reviews it would be small. But I was still amazed at the smallness of the bed. It wasn't a full..I don't know what size it was, but my husband and I barely fit, and we are fairly short! There was a hole in the baseboard that reminded us of the holes you see in cartoons for mice. We covered it and I had dreams of Tom and Jerry all weekend. The bathroom was so tiny that when I leaned over to brush my teeth, I slammed into the towel rack; I'm only 5 ft 4!! Sitting on the toilet is a challenge-again, cramped. The shower stall tiles are retro and not in a good way. The look DINGY AND DIRTY. There is zero lighting in the shower stall-which makes for a scary, scary shower and there were tiny flies all over the interior of the shower ceiling. The pacing of the shower?? good luck. Either scalding hot or freezing cold. The room itself was nicely updated. Very pretty sheets, bedding, nice tv, great drapes. There was a Keurig coffee machine, but you have to pay for the coffee, which I did not do. I chose to walk to Dunkin Donuts at the 4 queens instead. It was loud..you're on Freemont. Don't expect quiet and you won't be disappointed in the noise level. I wasn't bothered by it. Maybe some of the rooms are bigger and cleaner. It's definitely something we can laugh about now, but we will not return to the Golden Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: trlett
Reviews.Content: The Golden Gate is a nice small hotel on Freemont Street. It is the oldest hotel in Las Vegas, and therefore the rooms are small and the hotel does not have the usual glitz and glamour of Las Vegas. The rooms have all been redecorated very nicely. The casino has a party atmosphere, and is a fun place to visit. The restaurants, especially the $1.99 shrimp cocktail, and the pancakes at Du-Par's are great. I usually stay on the strip, and decided to try downtown this time. I had a good time, and would do it again, but I will go back to the strip next time. I enjoyed my stay at Golden Gate, but I found that I missed the glitz of a larger hotel. The price is very reasonable, and I would recommend it, but I am not sure if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little hotel with a BIG Heart!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine R
Reviews.Content: We came for a quick weekend to visit family in the area, and to do computer work. We have always come down to the Golden Gate for the shrimp cocktail, which is still a terrific value. We had some issues with the room, warm, noisy and no desk to set-up a computer. Well, let me tell you, the manager and staff did absolutely everything in their power to ensure we were happy in our new cool, quiet room. As a matter of fact, they went above and beyond that, by bringing in a special table and chair where I could do my computer work. They were fantastic. A little hotel with a big heart! Best customer service ever. If you enjoy the Fremont Street Experience, get a room close to that, or request away to avoid the noise. Charming older hotel with lots of history.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overlooking the Fremont Street Experience.”
Reviews.Author: edog1308
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Gate for the 2nd time in 2 years last October. Was there for Halloween. The rooms are a little small, but clean and comfortable. The rooms overlooking Fremont Street have a great view. The windows open and if your room is on the first floor, you are only about 15 feet above the Fremont Street Experience. It can get loud at night as the partying goes on til all hours, but for the price, you cannot beat the view and the ambiance of a great old hotel. Will be back again for Halloween 2011 and I am staying at the Golden Gate once again. Check it out, you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: biblthmp
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip, and was disappointed. I was here for 3 days. Good points - Nice antique atmosphere, the hotel still looks vintage 1905, but with a few modern amenities. Located right on Fremont street, the Experience is right out the front door. The room was clean, with plenty of towels and toiletries. Everyone was praising the shrimp cocktail that was being offered for $1.99 Bad points - The walls are very thin, so one can hear every note, and intonation that is happening down at the experience. Every morning, my room would fill with cigarette smoke from my neighbors. The room was very small, and only had a full sized bed. Noting that I am 6"4", my feet hung over the end of the bed. There was no desk available in the room. I was supposed to right some reports, after work, and there was nothing to put my laptop on. The TV only had about 10 channels, and some of those are Spanish speaking only. The water pressure in the shower was horrible, barely more than a trickle, with both valves full open. The water temperature in the shower varied widely quickly, any time anyone in the whole hotel flushed their toilet, the shower temperature went really hot, and then quickly really cold. The curtains did not close well, and left a noticeable gap, that would let in much a lot of sunshine. Note, I was working third shift (11 PM to about 3 AM), so I was trying to sleep during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: CatherineSedona
Reviews.Content: For $28 a night plus $5 for internet it was a great deal. Room was decent size and the historic ambiance of the hotel added to the stay. Was unaware that the 4th floor where we stayed was built in the 1950's, and not original as the first two floors are, but still very much enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Damn Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dall1906
Reviews.Content: The Golden Gate is the real deal!! beautiful dancing dealers and a staff that treats you like a friend! We stayed on the Fremont side and it was a bit noisy, but come on.... it's LAS VEGAS!!! who comes to vegas for peace and quiet??? Walking around this hotel, you can help but marvel at the history and with only around 100 rooms, makes you wonder who has all stayed there! Food and hotel are good, the Casino Rocks!! Fremont is a great time, and the Gate is the pinnacle of this historic street! Will be back again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anyplace else”
Reviews.Author: jerryniels
Reviews.Content: I love the Golden Gate. I have stayed there the last 3 times that I have been to Vegas. There is diffenently pros and cons to staying at the Golden Gate. I feel in love with the place about 4 years ago,but at the time I didn't stay there,and had no plans on ever staying there due to the fact a lot of working girls was hanging out there. About 2 years ago I noticed that the girls were no longer there. I talked to a couple of the managers, and they informed me that they were in the process of cleaning things up. Ever since that point I now stay there. I do agree the Golden Gate can and is very loud during the FSE light show, but there are ways around it. I have stayed in the rooms facing Fremont Street, and rooms that are in the middle of the hotel. The rooms in the middle is much more quite, but the view is looking at a roof. IMHO if you are staying in Vegas on Fremont then you really aren't planning in staying in your room much. The biggest plusses for me when I stay at the GG is that the windows open. Being from WI when I visit in late Feb or March the rooms are to warm. I found that at the GG and in the hotels I have stayed at on the strip,and I truely believe that customer service is the highest priority to the management. I had a dealer tell me that he had dealt at a number of casinios and the GG encourge the dealers to talk and be friendly to the players if only 1 or 2 players are sitting at the table, again IMO it seems most of the other casinos I have been in wants to deal as fast as they can to get more money out of you when you are the only one at the table,and those casinos treat you as a "dollar" not a customer. It seems as the GG wants you to enjoy yourself as you lose your money. For me that is fine because I keep coming back. Yes the rooms are small,but remember the building is over 100 yrs old,and if you are lucky they do have some bigger rooms. I stayed in one of the bigger rooms in this trip. It is also tucked in a corner that you can hardly hear any noise even when the FSE is going on.I will let you find out for yourself which one that is due to the fact that I will be requesting it from now on.If I had to find one major fault with the GG is that it can be an adventure to take a shower.The first two times I stayed there the water presure and temp was unreliable.This trip I had no problems, but again the room I was staying in seemed as if it wasn't as "old". Also myself I feel it would be hard to justify tearing out all the plumbing to fix this problem. IMO it is part of the charm. For us 50+ yrs old,we grew up with plumbing like this even in the fanciest homes. I hope this helps, call me a little old fashion but the customer service given from the house keeper all the way up to the owners ( yes you do see the owners and upper managment walking around and chatting up all the customers not just the big spenders) asking how things are and if you need anything will keep me coming back. As a matter a fact I already have booked a room there this late fall.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: reviews1phxaz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Golden Gate during Memorial Day weekend. They had the best rates in Vegas for the 3 day weekend. Our room was small and the bathroom was even smaller. It didn't matter because the room was extremely clean and had been recently renovated. It had a new tv, matress, linens, carpet, and even fresh paint on the walls. The bathroom on the other hand was not renovated but still very clean so it didn't bother me. I saw a couple other rooms and they looked good too. They were also bigger! I have stayed at many hotels downtown and on the strip. I have to say this was one of my favorite trips and our hotel choice had a lot to do with it. Based on the rooms alone I would give the Golden Gate a 3. Based on the customer service I give this hotel a 5. Managment at this hotel was very helpful. I would definetly return to the Golden Gate.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas's hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: montreux
Reviews.Content: The Golden Gate Hotel & Casino is located at #1 Fremont St. in downtown Las Vegas. If a very quiet boutique hotel appeals to you you can't go wrong here. Book online and get unblievable rates. The Casino here is as good as it gets and if you don't feel in the mood to gamble you can come and go without having to walk through the play area. I particularly like their 24 hour restuarant: DuPar's.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: king4thisday
Reviews.Content: The Casino is fun and has reasonable prices for games. Shrimp was good but you can get it at a local supermarket. It is noisy until 12 but you are in Vegas. Rooms are clean but it is still a little dirty. It is great if you are planning to stay out all night and just want a room to sleep in and are with a group of guys. If you are with some girls . Go some place else they would not like the hotel part. For the most part you get what you pay foe. I enjoyed my time but you have to understand $40 for a room means it is not perfect by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a few extra dollars and plan your stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: JerriOPhile
Reviews.Content: Overall, my freshman experience in Downtown Las Vegas was fun and memorable. Unfortunately, none of that had to do with my hotel of choice. I went by price and the claims of "best shrimp cocktail" when booking my room, which was an unfortunate choice. The place is more "old" than "historic." I understand the importance of homage to the past, but this place is due for an update. Especially if they want to throw scantily clad dancers above the tables and expect you to take them seriously. Spend a few extra dollars and stay elsewhere, like Four Queens or Las Vegas Club.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of Las Vegas hotels”
Reviews.Author: DaSenator
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay. The staff is friendly and the rooms are spotless. You can't beat the price. I like walking out the door into Fremont street with so much to do without taking a cab!

Reviews.Title: “How fun is this??”
Reviews.Author: MesquiteSyd
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay @ the Golden Gate. Talk about history! Even the doors are narrow by today's standards. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have stayed in any hotel. The casino rocks after 5 pm, the dealers are all beautiful young women that deal, then dance, and then get a break. The 1.99 shrimp cocktails are another bit of history. This isn't the Bellagio, it is a traveler friendly, gaming enthusiast mecca!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump”
Reviews.Author: bvsandassociates
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great disappoitment to me and my wife. First off it is very noisy there! so if you are wanting to sleep not a good idea!! The garbage trucks were literally outside our room and we got no sleep!!! The elevator also smelled of old urine!! Clientele is also kidda of scuzzzy!! Garbage truck came at 6am saturday morning and took 30 minutes to finish route and we told front desk but, there is nothing we can do!! Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: rockchalktraveler
Reviews.Content: O.K. this is not your typical Vegas hotel. I have had the opportunity to stay in some real dumps in Vegas but this was truly a treat. It is old but that is really a big part of it's charm. The room was very clean and most comfortable. We had a small room but with the Hi-Def flat screen TV and the nice bedding it was truly comfortable. The old time bathtub was big and deep and while the bathroom was small it was convenient and clean. It was a classic hotel and our stay was very comfortable. The valet parking is convenient and safe. Only bad thing is that they do not have any luggage carts so it was quite a chore unloading our car since we had quite a bit of stuff to unload. The check-in was quick and easy and the people were very friendly. We were fortunate as our room was on the backside of the hotel and the noise from Fremont St. wasn't too bad (I could only imagine how loud it was on the front side however!) Would we stay again? You bet you. While I didn't do so well at the craps table I did get my fill of the shrimp cocktail for which they are famous for. Love the Golden Gate.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: sheranth
Reviews.Content: Great prices, friendly staff & awesome food, casino pays better than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: mwahl88
Reviews.Content: The room was small and needs to be updated. There is only a amall step in shower. The door had about a two inch gap on the bottom. If you use the bottled water or coffee that is in your room you will be charged extra. The location is good, right on Freemont street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here again. I had mixed emotions on my last review of this hotel. Here is why I like this hotel. The room rates are good. It is a very small hotel and casino, which makes it cozy. It's easy to get to your room. The beds are comfortable, nice tv's in room. The decore is nice, with newer furnishings. What I don't like is.. The bathrooms. They haven't redone the bathrooms. They are old, very old. The grout around the tile is stained on the floors which makes it look dirty. We had a tub/shower, the bottom of the tub was stained. The caulking around the tub was just plain gross. Seems like caulking would be an easy fix, but still stays the same. The noise level in the rooms. We stayed in a room away from Fremont Street, I could hear the music from Fremont but not as bad in this room as it would be in a room on Fremont Street. Our room was small but for two not a bad size. The bathroom counter had nice space on it, where our other rooms here did not. I just had one morning in the shower when the water turned cold but returned to normal rather quickly. A disappointment is they are now charging for your in-room coffee. In charging for the coffee, they only had a very strong bold coffee in the room. I might have used some if there was a lighter coffee available. Had some luck in the casino. Fairly easy to get a drink. I like the small size of the casino. It's very easy to find the people you are with. Shrimp cocktails were good as always. Du Par's restaurant, very good food. Pancakes and the Prime Rib dinner were delicious. We think about staying somewhere else but always end up booking here.

Reviews.Title: “great place great price”
Reviews.Author: kimc337
Reviews.Content: very clean old school hotel, no view but not their for the view in room but everything else was great. great price

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a night just dont pay more than $35 to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: trico711
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay downtown for cheap this is a decent place to stay, its not a great room, there is no iron, blow dryer and the a/c doesnt work very good............ personally i would not stay there again unless all else fails... spend the extra money and stay at golden nugget.

Reviews.Title: “"nice" hotel if you do not want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: silver30001
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a nice location, very close to fremont experience. it was cheap and clean. however, it suddenly becomes expensive because there is no free wifi or parking. there was only valet parking in the hotel, the valets are rude when you do not give tip. our room was in the second floor right above the utility entrance. the noise from the delivery from 4-6am can be heard inside our room. at 3am there seem to be a garbage truck collecting trash. from 12mn until 3am, drunk people can be heard along the hallway. to top it all off, i can hear my neighbors upstairs when i was taking a shower. all these noise are guaranteed to keep you awake all night. our room, and also the bathroom, was also so small that my partner and i have to walk one at a time. they required a $100 security deposit that they didn't bother to inform us about. i felt it was rude that they just charged it on our card without telling us.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 100 years old--although I miss the piano”
Reviews.Author: galtroark
Reviews.Content: They had great piano players in the deli area (where you get the shrimp cocktail for $1.99) that would play absolutely any request (including old standards that almost no one remembers) for tips a few years ago. Sad to say, that's gone with the wind. But this historic L.V. hotel (maybe the oldest that's still standing), after having undergone some renovations, is still a value for the price. I just came from there, and the $29 or so (plus about $5 tax) per night in the middle of the week, seems like a bargain. My only complaint is that on cold winter nights, the heating system in my room didn't keep the room warm enough to be really comfortable. But all things considered, this may be the best value in Vegas for the price. If you want to avoid the noise from the "Fremont Experience", stay on the Main Street side.

Reviews.Title: “One more good stay at the Gate!”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and odd shaped, it's a very old quirky building with only 1 elevator, if you get a room towards the front of the building, it will be loud until midnight. All that being said, if you want a decent, recently renavated, inexpensive, comfortable room, with no check in line in an outstanding downtown location, this is the place to be. Staff is friendly, casino is great, it's not the Wynn, or even the Golden Nugget, but for what it is, it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “They should pay you to stay here”
Reviews.Author: GardenaJoe
Reviews.Content: First of all when my wife booked rooms on VegasView for $10 per night I said how do they turn a profit. Then when I lost $300 in an hour I quickly remembered how LOL! Well when we pull up to Valet I see that the parking lot is about the size of Burger Kings parking lot. I ask for help with the luggage and the Valet brings me the cart. So now I'm the Bellman, and I push all of my stuff up to the desk, then the room. We get on the only elevator with this cart and I'm miserable. Open the room and so small that they should consider bunk beds. The window was open I'm like WTF? I thought windows in Vegas hotels didn't open? I'm not to worried cause I'm only on the 2nd floor. The shower was a walk in shower meaning my feet are two feet away from the toilet, I showered in my Nikes. Late night when my wife and I returned to the hotel we saw a few "ladies of the evening" going up and down the elevator. They say its the oldest hotel in Vegas to me that's nothing you want to brag about. It's across the street from the Greyhound Station so watch out for the Pimps, runaways, drug users etc. Terrible place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: stevez49
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nites there. I really enjoy playing the slots and table games there. I decided to stay there this and was not disappointed. The room was small but clean and comfortable. Others talk about fremont st loudness. But if your really tired you'll sleep just fine. They have a great cafe and deli with fresh food that is not frozen. And excellent variety of pies. There is a fun atmosphere throughtout the casino. The have go-go type dancers that perform inbetween the table games. on busy nites they have 3 or 4 cocktail servers that make sure you don't go thirsty. And this for a casine with about 300 slots and about 20 table games!!! Also I find my money lasting longer here than other casinos. Comps for food and rooms are easy to come by. I will be staying here again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Try this hotel for a one night stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: armysis93552
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I never went to the downtown part of las vegas and got this room as a last minute choose...the room was clean but the motel 6 has a bigger room then this hotel....The tv was nice and had more channels then our other hotel room we had for the bowling tournament.....We stayed in room 315 and the a/c was just blowing out hot air :( and the shower had the fight to keep it as hot water...those were the only downside...I would not stay again we were laying there in bed till 2 am listening to the music from outside......

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Utah_traveler99
Reviews.Content: It was a great stay, room was nice and clean but bathrooms are a little small. Located right on Fremont Street and valet your car at the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: deseashell
Reviews.Content: There were four of us in two rooms. We got a queen bed and they got two double beds. Our room was very small, dirty and the bathroom wasn't even big enough for one person! The shower was a nightmare. We were not given the choice of a tub/shower or a shower. Our friends' room was bigger and had a very nice tub/shower. The noise outside was horrible. I knew it may be small and noisy but this was ridiculous. The location is only good for Fremont Street and once you've seen it you don't have to go back. And they certainly don't care about many non smoking rooms. On our floor, the 4th, there were only a few rooms, but there were some very large rooms. We were not offered any larger room. Also they certainly need air cleaners on Fremont Street!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of noisy EARLY morning carpet cleaners”
Reviews.Author: megroves55
Reviews.Content: We were awakened very early the two out of three days we stayed at Golden Gate. We were on the west side, overlooking Main Street. If they would have warned us about the extremely noisy carpet cleaning service planned below our window, we could have asked for a different room. We did not know the first morning what the noise was from. The second morning we discovered the van below our window and vacuum hose all over the casino floor. When I called the front desk, I was told the manager was unavailable. At that point it was time to head to the airport. If you stay here, be very careful of what part of the hotel you are rented. Fremont Street is noisy, as is Main Street we learned. The lighting in all rooms is dismal. Granted, the price is low, but at the cost of losing sleep???

Reviews.Title: “MONEY STOLEN BY MAID, HOTEL DOESN'T CARE! RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyc6oh3
Reviews.Content: Hello, my name is Christine Clouthier and I would like to alert your customers and team of the HORRIBLE customer service at Golden Gate Hotel and Casino (located at 1 Fremont St here in Las Vegas, NV).  My boyfriend and I stayed there for a few days, and we asked for a maid to come into our room ONCE.  When we got back after she had cleaned, we noticed my suitcase pocket was slightly unzipped. When we opened the pocket, we realized that our $514 cash was missing from it!!  We called the hotel as soon as it happened, but the manager was not in.  We had to wait until the next day to file a report with security.  When the hotel manager came to speak with us, he told us that it was "too bad" and gave us contacts for a homeless shelter.  Then he called us today (over a week after this happened) and told us he was denying our claim and they would not even compensate us for the inconvenience.  He was extremely rude and even hung up on us while we were still discussing the issue.  We needed that $514 to drive back home all the way in New Hampshire.  We are $514 short now and on top of it, have no where to stay.  We cannot afford an attorney, but we want everyone to know about the horrible way this hotel treats it's customers and to be well aware of the risks of staying at this hotel and having the room cleaned. This hotel is in the middle of the ghetto of Las Vegas, the management is rude, and their customer service is the worst I've ever experienced. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO LOSE CASH FOREVER.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Downtown Vegas Casino”
Reviews.Author: pmacker
Reviews.Content: Yes its noisy, dated and not on the strip but i paid $19 for the room!! Took the bus (the deuce) which runs 24/7 up to the strip at night. Would recomend this place to anyone on a budget and doesnt mind not having a pool

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel with Modern Fun!”
Reviews.Author: DrGPadgett
Reviews.Content: Vegas Travelers - I stayed at the Golden Gate for four nights in early July, 2010. I have stayed here twice before, and it is even better than before. I arrived at about 9PM on Monday, and I was assigned to room 411. I had been used to the very small standard rooms, but this top-floor room was surprisingly large! It was clean and well-equipped. Room 411 was in the southeastern corner of the hotel; this room was the farthest from the Fremont Street sound and from the sounds of Main Street. I personally would have preferred to have a room in the front, overlookng the Fremont Street pedestrian mall (party zone), but room 411 is perfect for those who want quiet. The PRICE is definitely right here, and the value is amazing. If I had advance notice of my trip, I could have gotten this room for $19.70 per night (Fremont Street's "Summer of the 1970s: theme), but I got a $28 per night rate, with 24 hours notice. Excellent! I only used the room for sleep/shower/storage, so why spend more? When it comes to FUN, Golden Gate and the Fremont Street Experience have it figured out! Every evening, the casino was packed with players and partiers. By comparison, the Vegas Club and the Plaza casinos looked tired and quiet. Blackjack is 3:2 (yay!) with a $5 minimum, even at peak hours! The machines are good, although I could not find any full-pay video poker (the Four Queens has it, just two blocks away). There was a techno-pop DJ in front of the Gate each night, leading an active dance floor. There were Golden Gate dealer-entertainers at the BJ tables and serving drinks at the bar out front. Search YouTube for "Golden Gate Dancing Dealers" to check it out. I have never seen a better casino atmosphere, in 25 years of Vegas travels. As I mentioned, the theme on Fremont Street is "Summer of the 1970s", so there are disco bands and 1970s tribute acts everywhere on "The Street", as well as celebrity look-alikes. I saw "Captain Jack Sparrow", "Bret Michaels", "Gene Simmons", and "Prince". The FSE was packed each night. When you visit the Golden Gate, be sure to shoot dice with the regular dealers, too. They are very professional, even though they are "in the shadow" of the dancing-girl BJ dealers. I also wish that the piano player would return; I know that the dancing dealers' music would drown out the piano, so maybe the pianist can play in the afternoons...? I miss the old "Bandit Pianist", who led the crowd in a few barroom songs. Club 1906 is a good slot/player's club. Get your card when you're there, and you'll get good e-mail offers for your next trip. There is no pool, nor fitness center, but there is a good restaurant and a great snack bar. The former Bay City Diner and the snack bar are a bit more expensive now that they are run by DuPar's, but they are still very good. The parking in the back is valet only; a $2 tip ensures excellent service. To all of those STRIP-junkies: there was no line when I checked in, and there were two attendants. During the trip, I visited the MGM Grand (to play Sigma Derby and the Lion's Share Progressive), and I saw over two hundred sad people, suffering in a check-in line. Not for me. Housekeeping was excellent; my room was kept very well (by "Maria", I think). I did notice that the water temperature seems to "be haunted". I got used to it. I will be back to the Golden Gate. I have stayed at many different hotels, downtown and the strip, if readers have questions. I welcome the opportunity to "Talk Vegas". Gene Padgett! Retired Air Force Captain

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful....and NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: ginmi1976
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel in an awesome location right on the Freemont street Experience. It also has an historic charm about it being the oldest operating hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms are small (too small for a couple in my opinion. Ok is you are by yourself) but nice and clean with good amenities. The only downside is the noise from the loudspeakers at Freemont Street experience during the evenings. It starts around 8pm and doesn't stop until about 1am so if you want an early night (cause you have a morning flight the next day for example) then you can pretty much forget it. No sleeping before 1am!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but noisy stay”
Reviews.Author: RudeboyMoscow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in downtown near Experience, former center of entertaitment. Now its far from most central points of interest. It is pretty old. Renovation, if it was made looks old too. Smell of smoke in no-smoking room. Your windows will face street or nex t building roof equipment, no chance to escape noise from Experience anyway. It stops near 1 a.m. Best goal is its cheap price, good for one night sleep. Free valet parking means tipping all the time in and out, but sometimes we did'nt. Personell was quite polite. They blocked amount of stay plus deposit $100 on card and said it will be released next day, but it was on hold for three weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to get some sleep”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkjoe98
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms in this hotel are fine if you are only using them to store luggage. If you plan on getting any sleep, you had better ask for a room as far away from Freemont street as possible. The room we stayed in seemed quite dated, despite rumors that the rooms had been recently updated. The beds were in good shape, but not comfortable--the sheets were more akin to sandpaper. There was a small flat-screen TV in the room, but only had a few channels available for viewing. The bathrooms are very small. The toilet was very dated and had an awkwardly located flush handle. The shower had a cool cascade-style shower head, but the tub was dirty and the water temperature was anything but consistent. Bottom line: It's a good value if you are only going to Vegas to gamble and need an over-sized closet to store your belongings and maybe catch a power nap in the morning. We spent a good chunk of our time gambling at the casino below---really good looking women dealers in the evenings. Staff seemed friendly...just small, cramped, loud (could hear everything outside the room--freemont street & hallway, and uncomfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “these showers ruin everything”
Reviews.Author: gil013
Reviews.Content: my gf and i have been here before and liked it even though the showers were ridiculous, but the second time around the showers were worse very hot then very cold, not worth it even of you get the rooms for $15/night. We wont be back

Reviews.Title: “Tight Quarters!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRover999
Reviews.Content: After attending our convention at Ceasars for 3 days, we head down to Fremont Street for the cheap rates and looser odd's. The location of the GG is great, but the rooms were so tiny it was ridiculous. Rather noisy with the FSE... but that was expected, and not a problem after midnight. The furniture is much too large for the room, making it even more cramped. We were disappointed that the piano player has been done away with, as that was a big part of the "charm" of the bar area. Suggestions to management were definitely not welcome! Valet parking was fast, courteous and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are great, but if you don't care for small, older rooms, don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: ChinoJeno
Reviews.Content: Front desk and all other employees I encountered were VERY nice. The room was very small tho & bathroom extremely small, which is to be expected from an older hotel. Some simple inexpensive updates could help make room & bath feel larger. No iron, but they had coffee in room & good TV. If you don't like noise, don't get one of the rooms facing Fremont. Our windows opened up right at Fremont St. Experience & you could see & hear it all. But windows are probably the originals & noise came right through. Hard to hear TV or sleep if you happen to be in your room before midnight. If you're a night owl & don't mind that, then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings this time”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 different times with a week apart. I posted a review about a year ago loving this hotel. I still love it but we did encounter a couple of problems this time. Our first room was 302, we requested it, is a larger room. The decor is great. They have coffee makers in the room. The beds are very comfortable. It's clean. The bathrooms really need to be redone. This room has a shower only. It is a very small bathroom. There is tile everywhere and the grout is stained. I did experience in the shower the hot and cold. Oh my, it was awful on our first morning. Started out fine, soaped up, freezing cold water comes out, then burning hot. Took forever to finish. It was chilly in our room but could not get any heat. I don't know if they shut it off, or if it is broken. The noise, this rooms looks out onto Fremont street which is really neat. The windows fully open so you can hang your head outside. But... Last year we thought the noise from the light show was loud. This year there was a man singing all night long. He would stop for the lightshow and then start up again. You had to have the tv on full blast to hear it. It was not good at all. There was no escaping the noise. On our last night, we decided we needed some peace, could not stand the noise anymore, and switched to a room on the Main St. side. This was a smaller room and much more quiet. We could still hear everything from Fremont St. but it was much better. When we checked out we asked to have a room not on Fremont street for our next stay in a week. We were given room 410. This was a larger room, the same nice decor and comfy beds. The bathroom was a little larger but still needed redone. This bathroom didn't seem as clean. It also had a vanity area outside of the bathroom. There was a desk in this room. I guess this room is on the alley. In the evening the room was quiet. My mom woke up to the noise from the alley. I slept through it. Still love it but would not get a room on Fremont Street, doesn't sound like it's going to be quiet there. Sounds like they are trying to keep more entertainment on this end other than the light show. Love the casino, the shrimp cocktails. They have a pay computer to use in the little hotel lobby. Ate in the diner, food was very good. It's always packed full of people so a little wait. My dad has a sports car and parked in the valet with no problems. Yes, I would stay here again. But again, away from Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay downtown!”
Reviews.Author: all_vegas
Reviews.Content: Checked in early at 1PM and rooms(2) were ready, no wait at all. Recieved the rooms we requested and were very pleased with them. The rooms are small compared to others in Vegas but were nicely appointed. Bathrooms have not been renovated but functioned just fine, shower worked great. Both rooms were on the second floor overlooking Fremont street. Neither us or our parents had a problem with the noise level in our rooms, maybe if you are a light sleeper but I can't see it. Very lively place with friendly staff and the Bay City Diner is a great place to eat, good food at good prices. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Gate is Great!”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: As I found with Bill’s on the Strip on my last trip, the Golden Gate offered 2 minutes or less access to everything. The renovation of the oldest hotel in Vegas was well done, the rooms are clean, the décor is nice, if you want fancy, don’t bother, but if you want nice and convenient, this works great. The bathrooms are still old and un-remodeled, but they get the job done. The staff was always friendly and helpful (even met the owner who bought us a drink and chatted with us for a bit), and since our rooms were on the backside of the building on the 4th floor (we called it the penthouse tower) we never had any problems with noise. We will be back. The Casino, everybody was friendly (save one or 2 craps dealers, but as management told us, they are still working on improving everything) and the place had the most upbeat lively atmosphere of anywhere we went. Golden Gate Bay City Diner. Quick friendly service, good solid food, decent prices. It isn’t fancy or probably much better than any other coffee shop, but if you are in the neighborhood, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: cschuten
Reviews.Content: We got a fabulous deal for Valentine's/President's Day weekend, staying 4 nights for $185. This is the oldest hotel is Las Vegas built in 1906. The rooms have been remodeled so we were thinking after reading reviews that it would be okay. We're not in the room that much anyway. Here's what you need to know: 1. The rooms are crazy small. Small like 10x10. They've been remodeled and are appointed nicely. HOWEVER the a/c heating system is old. Like your Grandma old. We had a window unit and could never get it cold enough - It's February. 2. The bathrooms are severly outdated. My husband put it in perspective by saying this "These are bathrooms you only see in movies where people die". With that being said, The water temperature varies greatly. It goes from burn your face off hot to antartic cold all without warrant or warning. 3 The noise. OMG. There is no sleeping here....Not at night, not during the day, not when your neighbors come back and snap on the TV, NOT EVER. Good luck with this. 4. The smell. Let me start with I like seafood, but, the smell of the shrimp cocktail really got to me. It smells up the whole lobby and cafe area into the casino. Yuck is all I can say. 5. The staff is really nice. All of them. We checked out 2 days early, honestly we just needed some sleep and a good shower. 6. Bottom line - You can paint wheels and windows on a cracker box, but at the end of the day it's still a cracker box.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelmore12
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Nothing too fancy, but it is a really neat historical place to stay. Rooms are small but comfortable. I would suggest that you get a room not facing freemont st if you are a light sleeper. Good place at a low price and I would stay again. The restaurant serves a great breakfast. Don't bother trying other shrimp cocktails on freemont, Golden Gates are the best! I tried some for .99 cents at another place and didn't feel good afterwards. The free valet parking was great!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel With A Lot of Character”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: I've played and eaten at the Golden Gate many times but this was my first time staying there. Some of my friends have stayed there and enjoyed it very much so I pretty much knew I would like it also. I was too early for check in and the registration person checked in my bags while I wondered around Fremont. I stayed out a lot later than I expected and ended up not going back to the hotel until 9:30 and all the non smoking rooms were taken, my fault. Checked into a very nice room on the second floor with a queen size bed and full bath, not just the shower but bathtub also. The room didn't smell of smoke at all and was pleasantly surprised at how well the room was furnished. I truly love an in room coffee maker. The bathroom was actually nicer than I thought it would be but yes, you can tell this hotel has some age to it but the fixtures are new. I love all the dark woods in this hotel. It truly gives it an old fashion look. The only negative I have is the noise factor. Be careful where you stay if noise bothers you. I was in a room on the back and side of the hotel so the trucks and the noise from the dumpters were bothersome and started about 5 a.m. I did not hear too much noise from the FSE but that was probably because I stay out late. Next time I will be sure to ask for a room in the middle of the hotel. I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future and recommend it especially if you love downtown.

Reviews.Title: “why mess with a good thing”
Reviews.Author: juju323
Reviews.Content: love the history of the golden gate. the renovations they've done to the rooms completely compliment the architecture and style but i wish the casino would have retained a little of that same charm. shrimp cocktail is a must eat. music and go-go dancers on the card tables are tacky at best but luckily there are plenty of choices to play on fremont st. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Who sleeps in Vegas anyway?”
Reviews.Author: AA7482
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #303 right on Fremont St. for 3 nights and paid $29.00 a night. We could open our windows and see the Fremont Experience from our room. The hotel itself is very fascinating and full of history. If your into that you would like looking around at all the stuff they have around the casino. The Room is smaller than average hotel rooms that i have stayed in but it was just me and my dad so it was just fine. They come with LCD flat panel TV's in the room and they all have the iHome if your looking to listen to music or need an alarm clock like we did. We didn't have any problems with the water pressure or cleanliness of the entire room. Although, there was a lot of noice coming from outside all night long. So if you are looking to get a good nights rest, do not get a room on the Fremont side or the Main St side. The Casino is kind of small but very comfy at the tables. If your looking to play slots there are better places to go but if your looking to play craps or blackjack it is very accomodating. The dealers are all very friendly and welcoming. Also, starting at about 9 o'clock they have dancers in the pit area, which is pretty nice to look at. The Deli and restaurant are pretty affordable and you really can't beat the 99 cent shrip cocktail, but you do have to have a players card from there for the 99 cent deal. Or if your playing at the tables just ask the pit boss for a free voucher. The deli has really good sandwiches and other various snack food at fair prices. Overall, The Golden Gate is a very affordable hotel with a lot of history. It is a smaller hotel but a lot more cozy. I would definitely not recommend this for someone who is looking for a good nights sleep though, but who sleeps in vegas anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: yoga12
Reviews.Content: This Casino was in the Heart of the old strip. The staff was very polite and housekeeping was very attentive!! Our view from the room wasn't that wonderful, but we were only in the room for maybe 4 hours a night to shower and sleep. Bartenders/dealers were great, and the dancers at the game tables were a lot of fun. The rate of the rooms were reasonable. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the price and ambience”
Reviews.Author: TravlrAlan
Reviews.Content: For an average $25 a night, this place really shines. The theme as they say is turn-of-the-century San Francisco. So those of you expecting opulent suites with enough room to hold a WWE match can skip out of here. If you've ever been to a hotel in a major city like San Fran, Chicago, NYC, etc. you know those rooms can be pricey and small anyway. Well, these rooms are just as comparable in size but way cheaper. The remodeling is very nice with the basic amenities taken care of (comfortable bed, nice LCD TV, clean bathroom w/soap & shampoo, etc.). They don't have hair dryers and ironing boards/irons in every room, but you can get them from the front desk (we brought our own dryer so not sure about that being lent out). My only issue with the room itself was the windows. They still have the swing-open-to-the-side, thin & single-pane ones. Hopefully after enough revenue from the new upgrades, these can be completed in phase 2.
